data: PAL End of Life / Terminal Care Orders for Patients with COVID-19 (Prototype_

Patient meets all of the criteria for usual terminal care orders AND  
- Patient is COVID positive or presumed positive and is not a candidate for Critical Care 
- Patient is showing signs of rapid respiratory decompensation with no reversibility  
- Provider must have an updated discussion around diagnosis and short prognosis with patient, substitute decision maker and/or family
- Provider has updated Options for Care to DNR-1 and ready to de-escalate care  
- Consider calling Palliative Care at any point to discuss further treatment options

Review all previous orders and discontinue medications, labs, IV fluids, imaging, NG feeds, deep suctioning, fans and/or aerosol generating procedures, NP swabs, and any other interventions not contributing to relief of suffering and/or terminal symptom management
